question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable when possible.

I am a middle school math teacher who wants to reward students with excellent grades. Please help me create a prize wheel webpage with the following prizes: $5 cash, $10 cash, $20 cash, $50 cash, Study Master Time Manager, Error Correction Printer + Math Meme Tape, "Genshin Impact" Character Pencil Case + Function Coordinate Notebook + Draft Paper, Probability Question Mystery Box Pen, Honor of Kings Q-version Heroes + Sarcastic Quote Stickers. The webpage should have a cute style background that includes elements middle school students enjoy, with animation effects when the wheel spins.

checklist.title: Is the prize wheel core functionality fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements a spinning wheel mechanism through HTML5 Canvas/SVG and JavaScript, with proper physics-based deceleration and random/weighted result selection. Check if it includes prize highlighting when landing, and validation that prevents manipulation. Score 0 if the core spinning functionality is not implemented, 5 if basic spinning exists but lacks physics, and 10 if it includes realistic inertia, proper randomization, and anti-cheat mechanisms.

checklist.title: Are all the specified prizes properly represented on the wheel?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether all 9 required prizes ($5 cash, $10 cash, $20 cash, $50 cash, Study Master Time Manager, Error Correction Printer + Math Meme Tape, 'Genshin Impact' Character Pencil Case + Function Coordinate Notebook + Draft Paper, Probability Question Mystery Box Pen, Honor of Kings Q-version Heroes + Sarcastic Quote Stickers) are included on the wheel with equal or intentionally weighted probabilities. Deduct 1 point for each missing prize or if prizes are not clearly readable when the wheel is stationary. Full points require visually distinct prize segments with proper spacing.

checklist.title: Is the animation effect for the wheel spin implemented effectively?
checklist.description: Check if the wheel animation includes smooth rotation transitions, proper easing functions (initial acceleration and gradual deceleration), audio feedback, and visual indicators during spinning. Score 3 points for basic rotation, 3 additional points for proper easing physics, 2 points for spinning sound effects, and 2 points for visual feedback (like sparkling effects or dynamic highlights). Ensure the animation runs at consistently smooth framerates (minimum 30 FPS).

checklist.title: Does the implementation include a cute style background with middle school student appeal?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the background incorporates age-appropriate design elements that appeal to middle school students (gaming references, math symbols, colorful patterns, etc.). Background should be relevant to both prize themes (games like Genshin Impact/Honor of Kings and educational items) without overwhelming the main prize wheel. Deduct 5 points if the background is generic/stock, 3 points if it's too childish or too mature, and 3 points if it competes with or obscures the wheel functionality.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as rapid repeated clicks, browser resizing, touch vs. mouse interactions, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Confetti explosion for high-value prizes 2. Prize history tracking 3. Teacher controls for probability adjustment 4. Animated characters reacting to prizes 5. Math formula animations). Add 2 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple animation systems) 2. Function modules unrelated to the prize wheel (e.g., unrelated games) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive particle systems that cause lag). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating wheel logic/view/animation layers), code organization, and maintainability. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 3 points if variable naming is inconsistent or unclear. Check for browser compatibility across at least Chrome, Firefox and Safari. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors with appropriate complementary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 16px, appropriately playful yet readable fonts). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Spin button feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Wheel rotation animation should be fluid (60fps if possible) 3) Clear visual and audio guidance when a prize is won. Deduct 5 points for laggy spinning animations, 3 points for missing winner announcement effects, and 5 points for unresponsive or hard-to-find spin button. The full score is 10 points.
